newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ sets FIF return rate at 12 pct for 1996/97 tax.
newsitem.headline: NZ sets FIF return rate at 12 pct for 1996/97 tax.

text.p: New Zealand's deemed rate of return used for the purposes of the foreign investment fund regime was set on Wednesday at 12.04 percent for the 1996-97 income year, Revenue Minister Bill Birch said.
The FIF regime taxes the income earned by foreign entities on behalf of New Zealand residents, where the controlled foreign company rules do not apply.
The deemed rate of return method is one of four methods for calculating FIF income or loss.
"The rate of 12.04 percent will apply to all types of investments, including interests in superannuation schemes and life insurance policies," Birch said.
